title: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index 2000 (SLEDAI-2K)
description: Stratifies severity of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) based on 24 clinical and laboratory parameters, allowing documentation of persistent disease activity.

parameters.name: seizure
parameters.description: Recent onset seizure (exclude metabolic, infectious, or drug causes)

parameters.name: psychosis
parameters.description: Altered mental function with impaired reality perception (exclude uremia, drugs)

parameters.name: organic_brain_syndrome
parameters.description: Altered mental function with impaired cognition, memory, or concentration

parameters.name: visual_disturbance
parameters.description: Retinal changes of SLE (cytoid bodies, retinal hemorrhages, exudates, hemorrhage in choroid or optic neuritis)

parameters.name: cranial_nerve_disorder
parameters.description: New onset sensory or motor neuropathy involving cranial nerves

parameters.name: lupus_headache
parameters.description: Severe persistent headache, may be migrainous, nonresponsive to narcotic analgesia

parameters.name: cva
parameters.description: New onset cerebrovascular accident (stroke)

parameters.name: vasculitis
parameters.description: Ulceration, gangrene, tender finger nodules, periungual infarction, splinter hemorrhages, or biopsy/angiogram proof

parameters.name: arthritis
parameters.description: ≥2 joints with pain and signs of inflammation (tenderness, swelling, or effusion)

parameters.name: myositis
parameters.description: Proximal muscle aching/weakness with elevated CPK/aldolase or EMG changes or biopsy showing myositis

parameters.name: urinary_casts
parameters.description: Heme-granular or red blood cell casts

parameters.name: hematuria
parameters.description: >5 RBCs/high power field (exclude stone, infection, or other causes)

parameters.name: proteinuria
parameters.description: New onset or recent increase >0.5 g/24 hours

parameters.name: pyuria
parameters.description: >5 WBCs/high power field (exclude infection)

parameters.name: rash
parameters.description: New or ongoing inflammatory type rash

parameters.name: alopecia
parameters.description: New or ongoing abnormal patchy or diffuse hair loss

parameters.name: mucosal_ulcers
parameters.description: New or ongoing oral or nasal ulcerations

parameters.name: pleurisy
parameters.description: Pleuritic chest pain with pleural rub, effusion, or pleural thickening

parameters.name: pericarditis
parameters.description: Pericardial pain with rub, effusion, or ECG/echo confirmation

parameters.name: low_complement
parameters.description: Decreased C3, C4, or CH50 below normal lab limits

parameters.name: increased_dna_binding
parameters.description: Increased anti-dsDNA antibody binding above normal range

parameters.name: fever
parameters.description: Temperature >100.4°F (38°C) excluding infection

parameters.name: thrombocytopenia
parameters.description: Platelets <100 × 10⁹/L excluding drug causes

parameters.name: leukopenia
parameters.description: WBC <3 × 10⁹/L excluding drug causes

ranges.interpretation: No active disease. Continue routine monitoring and current management.
Mild disease activity. Consider treatment adjustment if symptoms are bothersome or if there is organ involvement.
Moderate disease activity. Treatment modification usually indicated. Consider increasing immunosuppression.
High disease activity. Significant treatment intensification needed. Consider aggressive immunosuppression.
Very high disease activity. Urgent aggressive treatment required. Consider hospitalization and high-dose immunosuppression.

references: Gladman DD, Ibañez D, Urowitz MB. Systemic lupus erythematosus disease activity index 2000. J Rheumatol. 2002 Feb;29(2):288-91.

Buyon JP, Petri MA, Kim MY, Kalunian KC, Grossman J, Hahn BH, et al. The effect of combined estrogen and progesterone hormone replacement therapy on disease activity in systemic lupus erythematosus: a randomized trial. Ann Intern Med. 2005 Jun 21;142(12 Pt 1):953-62.
Touma Z, Urowitz MB, Gladman DD. SLEDAI-2K for a 30-day window. Lupus. 2010 Jan;19(1):49-51. doi: 10.1177/0961203309346505.
formula: Sum of weighted scores for 24 items (8 points for CNS/vascular, 4 points for renal/musculoskeletal, 2 points for serositis/dermatologic/immunologic, 1 point for constitutional/hematologic)
notes: SLEDAI-2K allows documentation of persistent disease activity in rash, alopecia, mucosal ulcers, and proteinuria
The most appropriate cutoff for active disease is 3-4 points
A score ≥6 generally indicates need for therapy
Scores >45 are uncommon in clinical practice
